again.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: one more time – used when something has happened or been done before
again.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Can you say that again? I didn’t hear.
Mr Khan’s busy. Can you try again later?
In 1997, the family moved house yet again.
Once again, Drew was under arrest.
again.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: back to the same state or situation that you were in before
again.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: She stayed and nursed him back to health again.
It’s great to have you home again.
again.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: used to give a fact or opinion that explains or adds to something you have just said
again.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: And again, these workshops will benefit the community widely.
again.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: used when you want someone to repeat information that they have already given you
again.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: What did you say your name was again?
again.translation[0].note_box[0].items[0: Again usually comes at the end of a sentence
